intro: Hedypnois hieracioides, commonly known as the common hedypnois, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters, with finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hedypnois hieracioides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
